verses.text_plain: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
verses.verse_html: 1Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

verses.text_plain: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.verse_html: 2Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

verses.text_plain: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:
verses.verse_html: 3But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

verses.text_plain: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.
verses.verse_html: 4That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

tokens.strong_raw: G1722 G3588 G5318 lemma.TR:εν lemma.TR:τω lemma.TR:φανερω

verses.text_plain: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.verse_html: 5And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

verses.text_plain: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.
verses.verse_html: 6But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

tokens.strong_raw: G1722 G3588 G5318 lemma.TR:εν lemma.TR:τω lemma.TR:φανερω

verses.text_plain: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
verses.verse_html: 7But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

verses.text_plain: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
verses.verse_html: 8 Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

verses.text_plain: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.
verses.verse_html: 9After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

verses.text_plain: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.verse_html: 10Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.

verses.text_plain: Give us this day our daily bread.
verses.verse_html: 11Give us this day our daily bread.

verses.text_plain: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
verses.verse_html: 12And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

verses.text_plain: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.
verses.verse_html: 13And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.

verses.text_plain: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:
verses.verse_html: 14For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

verses.text_plain: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.verse_html: 15But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

verses.text_plain: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.verse_html: 16Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

verses.text_plain: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;
verses.verse_html: 17But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;

verses.text_plain: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
verses.verse_html: 18That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.

tokens.strong_raw: G1722 G3588 G5318 lemma.TR:εν lemma.TR:τω lemma.TR:φανερω

verses.text_plain: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:
verses.verse_html: 19Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:

verses.text_plain: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:
verses.verse_html: 20But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

verses.text_plain: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.verse_html: 21For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

verses.text_plain: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
verses.verse_html: 22The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

verses.text_plain: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!
verses.verse_html: 23But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!

verses.text_plain: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.verse_html: 24No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

verses.text_plain: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?
verses.verse_html: 25Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?

verses.text_plain: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.verse_html: 26Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?

verses.text_plain: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
verses.verse_html: 27Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

verses.text_plain: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:
verses.verse_html: 28And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

verses.text_plain: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.verse_html: 29And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.verse_html: 30Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?

verses.text_plain: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
verses.verse_html: 31Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

verses.text_plain: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
verses.verse_html: 32(For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

verses.text_plain: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.verse_html: 33But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

verses.text_plain: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
verses.verse_html: 34 Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
